Get Involved with OpenNews

OpenNews is about growing the community around open development in journalism. As a result, it's only as successful as you make it. That's why we need you involved at every step of the way. So please, join in.

Build With Us

Our Code Sprints initiative is designed for developers and newsrooms that want to make small, open-source tools that fill real-world needs in newsrooms around the globe. Through Code Sprints, we’ve helped fund data visualization tools, election data parsers, civic data scrapers and more. Find out more and pitch your idea.

We also sponsor journalism-themed hack days around the world this year, and would love for you to take part.

  • We’re actively looking for partners to host hack days, so let us know what you’re up to.
  • If you’re a developer who wants to hack with us, check our hack day page to find out what’s happening near you.

Contribute to Source

Source is our site dedicated to journalism code and the community around it. We run regular features delving deeply into news code, as well as work to index all of the code that’s out there in the journalism space. We can’t do it without your help.

  • If you’re writing code in the journalism space and want to document your work for Source, or if you’re a writer that wants to help document others' work, we want to hear from you.
  • If you’re a coder who wants their open code listed in the Source Code Index, submit to get it listed.

Join our Community

We run OpenNews in the open, and would love for you to join in our weekly calls, our mailing list, or interact with us on Twitter.

  • OpenNews Community Calls every other Wednesday at 11am EST.
  • OpenNews on Twitter, ask questions, find out what we’re up to, and let us know what you’re doing.
  • OpenNews Mailing List. Join the mailing list and engage with a great community.
  • OpenNews Wiki. Check out archival content and other information.

Get Involved

The success of OpenNews depends on people like you! Join in:

  • Help with Source
  • Hold a Journalism Hack Day
  • Join our Community

Meet the 2013
Knight-Mozilla Fellows

Our 2013 Knight-Mozilla Fellows are hacking the news at the New York Times, the BBC, the Guardian, Zeit Online, Spiegel Online, the Boston Globe, ProPublica, and La Nacion. Learn more about their experience.

About Knight

Knight Foundation supports transformational ideas that promote quality journalism, advance media innovation, engage communities and foster the arts. The foundation believes that democracy thrives when people and communities are informed and engaged.

For more, visit knightfoundation.org

About Mozilla

Mozilla is a global non-profit dedicated to putting you in control of your online experience and shaping the future of the web for the public good—by creating great software and fostering communities that build and grow the open web.

Sign up to hear more, and, if you're willing, please join Mozilla.
